intro: Tragia dioica var. lobata, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, pale yellow flowers in clusters. Its seeds are encased in a fleshy, three-lobed capsule that splits open when mature. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
